semantic_identifier: 39: fix: Fix stalled-deal follow-up rule to correctly detect upcoming meetings across CRM + calendar sources

sections.text:
## Description

This PR fixes false positives in `sales_followup_recommendations` where the stalled-deal rule was emitting “no next meeting scheduled” despite an upcoming meeting existing.

### What changed
- Updated the “next meeting scheduled” evaluation to aggregate upcoming meetings from all synced sources:
  - CRM events (e.g., meeting/event objects)
  - Calendar-linked meetings (synced calendar events associated to the deal/contact)
- Normalized event status handling so canceled and no-show events do not satisfy the “next meeting exists” condition.
- Improved robustness for partial/dirty data:
  - Handles rescheduled meetings by selecting the earliest *valid* upcoming occurrence.
  - Correctly compares timestamps in a consistent timezone (UTC normalization) to avoid off-by-one-day / boundary issues.
  - Handles missing/unstable event IDs by falling back to stable matching fields (start time + external source key) when needed.

### Tests added
- Unit/integration coverage for:
  - Rescheduled meeting (old canceled event + new future event) should not trigger alert.
  - Timezone edge cases where local future events were previously treated as past.
  - Missing event IDs across sources still correctly detects an upcoming meeting.
  - Canceled/no-show-only events still trigger “no next meeting scheduled.”

### User impact
- Stalled-deal recommendations will stop flagging deals as missing a next meeting when a legitimate future meeting is present in synced CRM/calendar data.

## How Has This Been Tested?
